body:
This came up when I was on a server....

Instead of kicking/temp-banning players for spam and vulgar language. Why not mute them for a certain amount of time? (Depending on what the player does/says) Staff can decide how long the player should be muted. 


Again this is just an idea, so no salty comments pls :)
body_tagged:
This came up when I was on a server....

Instead of kicking/temp-banning players for spam and vulgar language. Why not mute them for a certain amount of time? (Depending on what the player does/says) Staff can decide how long the player should be muted. 


Again this is just an idea, so no salty comments pls :)
title: Bringing /mute to Avicus?

replies.body: It might work, except I think you should only really be able to temp mute people and perm mute if the case.
replies.body_tagged: It might work, except I think you should only really be able to temp mute people and perm mute if the case.

replies.body: I thought a little bit about this, but if someone is being rude/spamming they should just be banned. xD There's no point in keeping them around, they could still team kill, team troll, ect.. I like the idea of /mute but if someone is mad because they are muted they may start to team kill.
replies.body_tagged: I thought a little bit about this, but if someone is being rude/spamming they should just be banned. xD There's no point in keeping them around, they could still team kill, team troll, ect.. I like the idea of /mute but if someone is mad because they are muted they may start to team kill.

replies.body: I don't agree in permanent muting, maybe only say a temporary one, however, this is likely to frustrate said player even more & cause them to repeat offend, if it were to be implemented, it'd have to be, warm -> temp mute -> kick?

replies.body:
im pretty sure they're talking about staff only, but what if a staff didn't come and some guy was spamming rudeness everywhere- some servers have a system where if enough players (i think it has to be like half of players online or something) vote for a player to be kicked or muted. i don't think it could be abused due to the fact that the only people who would actually use it would be responsible and mature people, and there aren't enough idiots in one game to get someone kicked for, say, killing them.

i doubt this would get implemented but i just wanted to know if you guys think that system could get abused
replies.body_tagged:
im pretty sure they're talking about staff only, but what if a staff didn't come and some guy was spamming rudeness everywhere- some servers have a system where if enough players (i think it has to be like half of players online or something) vote for a player to be kicked or muted. i don't think it could be abused due to the fact that the only people who would actually use it would be responsible and mature people, and there aren't enough idiots in one game to get someone kicked for, say, killing them.

i doubt this would get implemented but i just wanted to know if you guys think that system could get abused

replies.body: -1 very very bad idea in my opinion. A player without chat-permissions could not interact with friends. Example: I say something like f*** 4 times in a single game, and then I get banned for 1 week out of the chat. Friends would say to me "Hi" and "How are you" etc. and you aren't able to interact with them. I have bad experiece with /mute.

replies.body:
/mute is meant for that one player who spams,swears,and advertises in chat can get a punishment, but isn't as severe as getting kicked or banned. 

What it does is it gives the player time to reflect. If they continue to break the rules, that's when /tempban comes into action. :)
replies.body_tagged:
/mute is meant for that one player who spams,swears,and advertises in chat can get a punishment, but isn't as severe as getting kicked or banned. 

What it does is it gives the player time to reflect. If they continue to break the rules, that's when /tempban comes into action. :)

replies.body:
The whole point of a punishment is to make sure than offenders stop what they are doing, essentially giving them time to reflect.

Mute can be a permanent solution. Just make sure to issue a permanent mute :P
Your post is hard to understand, as you are literally contradicting yourself.
